title: Top performers, Oct. 14, 2015
text:
Top performers, Oct. 14, 2015 Football Jason Bland, Kadena: Retook the Pacific lead in rushing yards, with 957, after gaining 276 yards on 31 carries with two touchdowns in the Panthers’ 27-14 win at Kubasaki on Friday. Shota Sprunger, Yokota: Rushed for 249 yards on 20 carries with three touchdowns and caught two TD passes, racking up 326 yards total offense and 400 all-purpose yards in the Panthers’ 62-34 win Friday at Nile C. Kinnick. Marcus Henagan, Yokota: Ran 15 times for 115 yards and two touchdowns and went 6-for-9 for 139 yards and a pair of scores. Chauncey Jamerson, Nile C. Kinnick: Gained 269 yards and scored twice on 30 carries, putting him second overall in the Pacific high school rushing chase with 936 yards on 85 carries. Caeleb Ricafrente, Matthew C. Perry: Racked up 220 yards on 12 carries and scored three times to help power the Samurai to a 40-14 win Friday at Robert D. Edgren. Myles Haynes, Seoul American: Returned a missed field goal 105 yards for a touchdown and ran 43 yards for a score to all but seal the DODDS Korea football title for the Falcons in a 31-16 win over Daegu. Jujuan King, Guam High: Rushed for two touchdowns in his return from a leg fracture, powering the Panthers into the island playoff semifinals with a 20-12 quarterfinal win over Okkodo. Girls volleyball Kalean Middleton, Robert D. Edgren: Tacked up 27 total kills and scored three block points, keeping the Eagles unbeaten in the DODDS Japan season with two straight-set weekend home wins over Zama. Tennis Shaun Freeman, Kadena: Won his singles tie, teamed with Carson Vath to win boys doubles, then with Maddie Howard for a mixed-doubles victory as the Panthers as a team outlasted Kubasaki 14-10 in the final regular-season tie of the Okinawa season. Cross country Arlene Avalos, Nile C. Kinnick: Became just the third girls runner in Kanto Plain league history to navigate the 2.1-mile Tama Hills Recreation Center course in under 13 minutes, clocking 12:58.2 in Saturday’s final regular-season meet. Join the conversation and share your voice. 
Show Comments
